items.title: Cloud VPN
items.description: Google Cloud Virtual Private Network (VPN) lets you connect your existing network to your GCP network via an IPsec connection. Alternatively, you can use it to connect two different Google Cloud VPN gateways.

label.title: Label
label.description: This field will be used to combine with [environment] and [prefix] to generate a unique VPC name

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: If specified this 'Environment' value will override the default value specified in the Terraform module

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: If specified this 'Prefix' value will override the default value specified in the Terraform module

pre_existing.title: Pre-Existing
pre_existing.description: If true, this resource should be considered managed external to this module and should not be created and/or updated.

name.title: Name
name.description: This field is used to specify an explict name to be used

unique_id.title: Unique ID
unique_id.description: Unique ID used to differentiate this resource from other 'like or similiar' duplicate resources when the name is not explitily specified

project_id.title: Project ID
project_id.description: If specified this 'Project ID' value will override the default value specified in the Terraform module

network.title: Network
network.description: The name of the vpc network to be connected with using Cloud VPN.

then.title: Hub Router (Manged Externally)
then.description: If the `Hub Router` is manged outside of this Terraform Module

else.title: Hub Router (Manged /w Terraform)
else.description: If the `Hub Router` is manged within this Terraform Module

oneOf.title: Advertise all subnets visible to the Cloud Router & all Custom subnets specified

then.title: Include Custom Subnet Advertisements
then.description: Include a User-specified list of individual IP ranges to advertise in custom mode

else.title: Do Not Include Custom Subnet Advertisements
else.description: Do not include any User-specified IP ranges to advertise, this field is not required and only included for UI generation

then.title: Hub VPN Gateway (Manged Externally)
then.description: If the `Hub VPN Gateway` is manged outside of this Terraform Module

else.title: Hub VPN Gateway (Manged /w Terraform)
else.description: If the `Hub VPN Gateway` is manged within this Terraform Module

then.title: Spoke Router (Manged Externally)
then.description: If the `Spoke Router` is manged outside of this Terraform Module

else.title: Spoke Router (Manged /w Terraform)
else.description: If the `Spoke Router` is manged within this Terraform Module

then.title: Spoke VPN Gateway (Manged Externally)
then.description: If the `Spoke VPN Gateway` is manged outside of this Terraform Module

else.title: Spoke VPN Gateway (Manged /w Terraform)
else.description: If the `Spoke VPN Gateway` is manged within this Terraform Module

stack_type_empty.title: Stack Type (EMPTY)
stack_type_empty.description: This field should not be set and is only included for UI generation

oneOf.description: Select this option to remove `stack_type` from JSON
oneOf.title: Empty (Clear Field)

stack_type.title: Stack Type
stack_type.description: The stack type for this VPN gateway to identify the IP protocols that are enabled. If not specified, IPV4_ONLY will be used.

oneOf.title: Ip V4 Addresses & Ip V6 Addresses

ike_version_empty.title: IKE Version (EMPTY)
ike_version_empty.description: This field should not be set and is only included for UI generation

oneOf.description: Select this option to remove `ike_version` from JSON
oneOf.title: Empty (Clear Field)

ike_version.title: IKE Version
ike_version.description: IKE protocol version to use when establishing the VPN tunnel with peer VPN gateway

redudancy_type_empty.title: Redudancy Type (EMPTY)
redudancy_type_empty.description: This field should not be set and is only included for UI generation

oneOf.description: Select this option to remove `redudancy_type` from JSON
oneOf.title: Empty (Clear Field)

redudancy_type.title: Redudancy Type
redudancy_type.description: Indicates the redundancy type of this external VPN gateway

interfaces.title: Interface Addresses
interfaces.description: IP address of the interface in the external VPN gateway. Only IPv4 is supported. This IP address can be either from your on-premise gateway or another Cloud provider's VPN gateway, it cannot be an IP address from Google Compute Engine.

advanced_tunnel_configuration.title: Advanced Tunnel Configurations
advanced_tunnel_configuration.description: Any values specified here will be applied to tunnels that are created. If more tunnels are created than addresses specified here they will be randomly assigned

advertised_route_priority.title: Advertised Route Prioirty
advertised_route_priority.description: The priority of routes advertised to this BGP peer. Where there is more than one matching route of maximum length, the routes with the lowest priority value win.

bgp_advertisement_disabled.title: Disable BGP Session
bgp_advertisement_disabled.description: If disabled, any active session with the peer is terminated and all associated routing information is removed.

hub_ipv4_address.title: Hub IPv4 BGP Peer Address
hub_ipv4_address.description: IPv4 address of the BGP interface, if not specified this IPv4 address will automatically assigned

spoke_ipv4_address.title: Spoke IPv4 BGP Peer Address
spoke_ipv4_address.description: IPv4 address of the BGP interface, if the `hub_ipv4_address` is not specified this IPv4 address will automatically assigned

ipv6_enabled.title: Enable IPv6 Advertisement
ipv6_enabled.description: If IPv6 is enabled, the peer connection can be established with IPv6 route exchange. IPv6 addresses are dynamically generated

oneOf.title: Dynamic Pre-Shared Secret
oneOf.description: When dynamic pre-shared secret is selected, the terraform module will 'randomly' generate a pre-shared key to use

oneOf.title: Static Pre-Shared Secret
oneOf.description: When static pre-shared secret is selected, the terraform module will use the string included in this field as the secret for phase 1 encryption\>All arguments including the following potentially sensitive values will be stored in the raw state as plain text: shared_secret

oneOf.title: GCP Secret Manager (COMING SOON)
oneOf.description: When static secret manager is selected, the terraform module will use the string referenced in Secret Manager for phase 1 encryption\>This functionality is on the road-map and only included as a place holder

static_pre_shared_secret.title: Static Pre-Shared Secret (EMPTY)
static_pre_shared_secret.description: This field should be set to empty remove `static_pre_shared_secret` from JSON

tunnel_count_gcp.title: Tunnel Count
tunnel_count_gcp.description: Number of tunnels that should be deployed

oneOf.title: Zero Tunnels
oneOf.description: Useful for troubleshooting VPN Gateways without the need for tunnel creation

oneOf.title: Single VPN tunnel
oneOf.description: A single tunnel won't provide high availability. You can add more tunnels later when needed.

tunnel_count_external.title: Tunnel Count
tunnel_count_external.description: Number of tunnels that should be deployed

oneOf.title: (0) Zero Tunnels
oneOf.description: Useful for troubleshooting VPN Gateways without the need for tunnel creation

oneOf.title: (1) Single VPN tunnel
oneOf.description: A single tunnel won't provide high availability. You can add more tunnels later when needed.

oneOf.title: (4) Four VPN tunnels
oneOf.description: Recommended for high availability/throughput  - 99.99% SLA. (Required for AWS)

tunnel_count_external_two.title: Tunnel Count
tunnel_count_external_two.description: Number of tunnels that should be deployed

oneOf.title: (0) Zero Tunnels
oneOf.description: Useful for troubleshooting VPN Gateways without the need for tunnel creation

oneOf.title: (1) Single VPN tunnel
oneOf.description: A single tunnel won't provide high availability. You can add more tunnels later when needed.

asn.title: 16-bit or 32-bit Autonomous System Numbers
asn.description: Hub BGP Autonomous System Number (ASN). Must be an RFC6996 private ASN, either 16-bit or 32-bit. The value will be fixed for this router resource. All VPN tunnels that link to this router will have the same hub ASN.

oneOf.description: Select this option to remove subnet_advertisements from JSON
oneOf.title: Empty (Clear Field)
Advertise all subnets visible to the Cloud Router
Advertise all subnets visible to the Cloud Router & all Custom subnets specified
